original: Namo tassa bhagavato arahato sammāsambuddhassa
analyzed: namaḥ tassa bhagavataḥ arahataḥ sammāsambuddhassa
translated: Homage to that Blessed One, the Worthy One, the Rightly Self-awakened One

original: Aṭṭhakathā
analyzed: aṭṭhakathā
translated: The Commentary

original: Saṃgāyanassa pucchā-vissajjanā
analyzed: saṃgāyanassa pucchā vissajjanā
translated: The Questions and Answers of the Recitation🔽Even if the world with its gods

original: Sadevakopi ce loko, āgantvā tāsayeyya maṃ;
analyzed: sa devakaḥ api ce lokaḥ āgantvā mam
translated: Should come and try to frighten me,🔽It would not be able to generate

original: Na me paṭibalo assa, janetuṃ bhayabheravaṃ.🔽Sacepi tvaṃ mahiṃ sabbaṃ, sasamuddaṃ sapabbataṃ;
analyzed: na me paṭibalaḥ assa janetum bhaya bheravam  sace ipi tvam mahim sabbam sa samuddam sa pabbatam
translated: Fear and terror in me.🔽Even if you, great nāga,🔽Were to pick up the whole earth with its seas and mountains

original: Ukkhipitvā mahānāga, khipeyyāsi mamūpari;
analyzed: ukkhipitvā mahā nāga khipeyyāsi mama upari
translated: And drop it on my head,🔽You would not be able to generate

original: Neva me sakkuṇeyyāsi, janetuṃ bhayabheravaṃ;
analyzed: nā iva me sakkuṇeyyā asi janetum bhaya bheravam
translated: Fear and terror in me;

original: Aññadatthu tavevassa, vighāto uragādhipa.
analyzed: aññadatthu vighātaḥ uraga adhipa
translated: It would only be a hardship for you, lord of serpents.🔽Do not generate anger from now on,🔽As you did in the past;

original: Mā dāni kodhaṃ janayittha, ito uddhaṃ yathā pure;🔽Sassaghātañca mākattha, sukhakāmā hi pāṇino;
analyzed: mā dāni kodham janayitthaḥ itas uddham yathā pure  sassaghātam ca mā akattha sukha kāmāḥ hi pāṇinaḥ
translated: Do not destroy the crops,🔽For living beings desire happiness.🔽Have loving-kindness towards beings,

original: Karotha mettaṃ sattesu, vasantu manujā sukhaṃ.
analyzed: karotha mettam sattesu vasantu manujāḥ sukham
translated: May human beings dwell happily.

original: Cattāro āsīvisā uggatejā ghoravisāti kho bhikkhave catunnetaṃ mahābhūtānaṃ adhivacanaṃ.
analyzed: cattāro āsīvisāḥ ugga tejāḥ ghora visā ati kho bhikkhave catunna etam mahābhūtānam adhivacanam
translated: “Four kinds of poisonous snakes with virulent venom”: this is a designation for the four great existences.

original: Pañca vadhakā paccatthikāti kho bhikkhave pañcannetaṃ upādānakkhandhānaṃ adhivacanaṃ.
analyzed: pañca vadhakā paccatthikā ati kho bhikkhave pañcanna etam upādānakkhandhānam adhivacanam
translated: “Five murderers as enemies”: this is a designation for the five aggregates as objects of clinging.

original: Chaṭṭho antaracaro vadhako ukkhittāsikoti kho bhikkhave nandīrāgassetaṃ adhivacanaṃ.🔽Suñño gāmoti kho bhikkhave channetaṃ ajjhattikānaṃ āyatanānaṃ adhivacanaṃ.
analyzed: chaṭṭhaḥ antara caraḥ vadhakaḥ ukkhitta āsikaḥ iti kho bhikkhave nandī rāgassa itam adhivacanam  suññaḥ gāmaḥ ti kho bhikkhave channā itam ajjhattikānam āyatanānam adhivacanaṃ
translated: The sixth inner enemy, the murderer with uplifted sword, is a term for delight and lust.🔽An empty village is a term for the six internal sense-spheres.

original: Corā gāmaghātakāti kho bhikkhave channetaṃ bāhirānaṃ āyatanānaṃ adhivacanaṃ.
analyzed: corāḥ gāma ghātakāḥ ati kho bhikkhave channa itam bāhirānam āyatanānam adhivacanaṃ
translated: Murderous brigands are a term for the six external sense-spheres.

original: Mahāudakaṇṇavo kho bhikkhave catunnetaṃ oghānaṃ adhivacanaṃ.
analyzed: kho bhikkhave oghānam adhivacanam
translated: A great flood is a term for the four floods.

original: Orimaṃ tīraṃ sāsaṅkaṃ sappaṭibhayanti kho bhikkhave sakkāyassetaṃ adhivacanaṃ.
analyzed: orimam tīram sa āsaṅkam sa paṭibhayanti kho bhikkhave sa kāyassa itam adhivacanam
translated: This shore is a term for personality.

original: Pārimaṃ tīraṃ khemaṃ appaṭibhayanti kho bhikkhave nibbānassetaṃ adhivacanaṃ.
analyzed: pārimam tīram khemam appaṭibhayanti kho bhikkhave nibbānassa etam adhivacanam
translated: The further shore is a term for Nibbana.

original: Vīriyārambhassetaṃ adhivacanaṃ.
analyzed: vīriya ārambhaḥ sa itam adhivacanam
translated: is a term for the arousing of energy.🔽Having gone to the land of the Kasmīrians,

original: Gantvā kasmīragandhāraṃ, isi majjhantikā tadā;
analyzed: gantvā kasmīragandhāram isi majjhantikā tadā
translated: the seer Majjhantika,🔽having satisfied the wicked Nāga,

original: Duṭṭhaṃ nāgaṃ pasādetvā, mocesi bandhanā bahū.
analyzed: duṭṭham nāgam pasādetvā mocesi bandhanā bahū
translated: released many from bondage.

original: Punapi bhante dakkhemu saṅgati ce bhavissati.
analyzed: puna api bhante dakkhemu saṅgati ce bhavissati
translated: If there is a meeting, we will see each other again.🔽Even today they weave a garland of the lineage

original: Ajjāpi santānamayaṃ, mālaṃ ganthenti nandane;
analyzed: ajjā api santāna mayam mālam ganthenti nandane
translated: in the Nandana Grove,

original: Devaputto javo nāma, yo me mālaṃ paṭicchati.🔽Muhuttoviya so dibbo, idha vassāni soḷasa;
analyzed: deva puttaḥ javaḥ nāma yaḥ me mālam paṭicchati  so dibbaḥ idha vassāni soḷasa
translated: The god who is called Javo, who accepted my garland,🔽For him, as for a god, sixteen years have passed by as if in a moment;

original: Rattindivo ca so dibbo, mānusiṃ sarado sataṃ.
analyzed: rattindivaḥ ca saḥ dibbaḥ mānusim saradaḥ satam
translated: For him, as for a god, a hundred human years have passed by as if in a day and night.

original: Iti kammāni anventi, asaṅkheyyāpi jātiyo;
analyzed: iti kammāni anventi asaṅkheyyā api
translated: Thus deeds follow (one), even if (one is reborn in) countless births;

original: Kalyāṇaṃ yadi vā pāpaṃ, na hi kammaṃ vinassati.
analyzed: kalyāṇam yadi vā pāpam na hi kammam vinassati
translated: Whether good or bad, a deed is never lost.

original: Yo icche puriso hotuṃ, jāti jāti punappunaṃ;
analyzed: yaḥ icche purisaḥ hotum jāti jāti punappunam
translated: If a man wishes to be reborn again and again in (good) births,

original: Paradāraṃ vivajjeyya, dhotapādova kaddamaṃ.
analyzed: para dāram vivajjeyya dhota pādā uva kaddamam
translated: He should avoid another’s wife, like a clod of mud a clean-washed (monk’s) foot.

original: Yā icche puriso hotuṃ, jāti jāti punappunaṃ;
analyzed: icche purisaḥ hotum jāti jāti punappunam
translated: If a woman wishes to be reborn again and again in (good) births,

original: Sāmikaṃ apacāyeyya, indaṃva paricārikā.
analyzed: sāmikam apacāyeyya indam vai paricārikā
translated: She should serve her husband, like a maid servant serves her mistress.

original: Yo icche dibbabhogañca, dibbamāyuṃ yasaṃ sukhaṃ;
analyzed: yaḥ icche dibba bhogam ca dibbam āyum yasam sukham
translated: If one wishes for heavenly enjoyments, heavenly life, fame and happiness,

original: Pāpāni parivajjetvā, tividhaṃ dhammamācare.
analyzed: pāpāni parivajjetvā tividham dhammam ācare
translated: Having avoided bad deeds, one should practice the three-fold good conduct.

original: Yaṃ bhikkhave sadevakassa lokassa samārakassa sabrahmakassa sassamaṇabrāhmaṇiyā pajāya
analyzed: yam bhikkhave sa devakassa lokassa sa mārakassa sa brahmakassa sa ssamaṇa brāhmaṇiyā pajāya
translated: Whatever in this world with its gods, Māras, and Brahmas, in this generation with its ascetics and brahmins,

original: sadevamanussāya diṭṭhaṃ sutaṃ mutaṃ viññātaṃ pattaṃ pariyesitaṃ anuvicaritaṃ manasā,
analyzed: sa deva manussāya diṭṭham sutam mutam viññātam pattam pariyesitam anuvicaritam manasā
translated: with its gods and humans, has been seen, heard, sensed, cognized, attained, sought after, pondered by the mind,

original: tamahaṃ jānāmi tamahaṃ abhiññāsiṃ, taṃ tathāgatassa viditaṃ, taṃ tathāgato na upaṭṭhāti.
analyzed: tam aham jānāmi tam aham abhiññāsim tam tathāgatassa viditam tam tathāgataḥ na upaṭṭhāti
translated: I know him, I have known him, the Realised One has understood him, the Realised One does not attend to him.

original: Iti kho bhikkhave tathāgato diṭṭhasutamutaviññātabbesu dhammesu tādīyeva tādī, tumhā ca pana tādimhā añño tādī uttaritaro vā paṇītataro vā natthīti vadāmi.
analyzed: iti kho bhikkhave tathāgataḥ diṭṭha suta muta viññātabbesu dhammesu tādīyā iva tādī tumhā ca pana tādimhā aññaḥ tādī uttaritaraḥ vā paṇītataraḥ vā natthi iti vadāmi
translated: Thus, monks, the Realised One is just the same in regard to things that are seen, heard, sensed, or known, and there is no other ascetic or contemplative or god or Māra or Brahmā or anyone else in the world who is able to speak about the Realised One in this way.

original: Suvaṇṇabhūmiṃ gantvāna, soṇuttarā mahiddhikā;
analyzed: suvaṇṇa bhūmim gantvāna soṇuttarā mahiddhikā
translated: Having gone to the Golden Land, Soṇa and Uttara, the Greatly Powerful,

original: Pisāce niddhametvāna, brahmajālamadesisuṃ.
analyzed: pisāce brahma jālam adesisum
translated: Having driven out the demons, taught the Brahmajāla.

original: Samaṇā mayaṃ mahārāja, dhammarājassa sāvakā;
analyzed: samaṇāḥ mayam mahā rāja dhammarājassa sāvakā
translated: We are ascetics, Great King, disciples of the Dhamma King,

original: Taveva anukampāya, jambudīpā idhāgatā.
analyzed: tava iva anukampāya jambudīpā idha āgatā
translated: Out of compassion for you, we have come here from India.

original: Ahaṃ buddhañca dhammañca, saṅghañca saraṇaṃ gato,
analyzed: aham buddhañca dhammañca saṅghañca saraṇam gataḥ
translated: I have gone for refuge to the Buddha, the Dhamma, and the Saṅgha,

original: Upāsakattaṃ desesiṃ, sakyaputtassa sāsane.
analyzed: upāsaka ttam desesim sakyaputtassa sāsane
translated: I have been taught the lay follower’s training, in the Sakyan Son’s Dispensation.

original: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā verañjāyaṃ viharati naḷerupuci mandamūle.
analyzed: tena samayena buddhaḥ bhagavā verañjāyam viharati naḷerupuci mandamūle
translated: At that time the Buddha, the Fortunate One, was dwelling near Verañjā, at the Naḷeru Pipphali Cave.

original: Saggārohaṇasopāṇaṃ, aññaṃ sīlasamaṃ kuto;
analyzed: sagga ārohaṇa sopāṇam aññam sīla samam kutas
translated: The ladder to ascend to heaven, what is there equal to virtue?

original: Dvāraṃ vā pana nibbāna, nagarassa pavesane.
analyzed: dvāram vā pana nibbāna nagarassa pavesane
translated: Or the door to enter the city of Nibbāna.

original: Alameva kātuṃ kalyāṇaṃ, dānaṃ dātuṃ yathārahaṃ;
analyzed: alam eva kātum kalyāṇam dānam dātum yathāraham
translated: It is good to do good deeds, to give gifts as is fitting.

original: Pāṇiṃ kāmadadaṃ disvā, ko puññaṃ nakarissati.
analyzed: pāṇim kāma dadam disvā kaḥ puññam na karissati
translated: Having seen the hand that gives what is desired, who would not do merit?

original: Dassāmannañca pānañca, vatthasenāsanāni ca;
analyzed: dassām annañca pānañca vattha senāsanāni ca
translated: We will give food and drink, and robes and lodgings,

original: Papañca udapānañca, dugge saṅkamanāni ca.
analyzed: papañca udapānam ca dugge saṅkamanāni ca
translated: And wells and water-troughs, and bridges over difficult fords.

original: Mahāaṭṭhakathañceva, mahāpaccarimevaca;
analyzed: mahāaṭṭhakatham ca iva mahāpaccarim eva ca
translated: The Great Commentary, and the Great Chronicle,

original: Kurundiñcāti tissopi, sīhaḷaṭṭhakathā imā;🔽Buddhamittoti nāmena, visutassa yasassino;
analyzed: kurundiñcā ati tissaḥ pi sīhaḷa ṭṭhakathāḥ imāḥ  buddhamittaḥ ti nāmena visutassa yasassinaḥ
translated: And the Kurundi Commentary—these three Sinhalese commentaries,🔽Having heard from the Elder, the wise one who knows the Vinaya,

original: Vinayaññussa dhīrassa, sutvā therassa santike.
analyzed: vinayaññussa dhīrassa sutvā therassa santike
translated: The illustrious one named Buddhamitta,

original: Upaddavākule loke, nirupaddavato ayaṃ;
analyzed: upaddava ākule loke nirupaddavataḥ ayam
translated: In a world troubled by calamities, this (commentary) is free from calamities.

original: Ekasaṃvacchareneva, yathā niṭṭhaṃ upāgatā;
analyzed: eka saṃvaccharena iva yathā niṭṭham upāgatā
translated: In just one year it was completed.

original: Evaṃ sabbassa lokassa, niṭṭhaṃ dhammūpasaṃhitā;
analyzed: evam sabbassa lokassa niṭṭham dhamma upasaṃhitā
translated: Thus for the whole world, which is united with the Dhamma,

original: Sīghaṃ gacchantu ārambhā, sabbepi nirupaddavā.
analyzed: sīgham gacchantu ārambhā sabbe api nirupaddavā
translated: May all undertakings quickly proceed, free from calamities.

original: Ciraṭṭhitatthaṃ dhammassa, karontena mayā imaṃ;
analyzed: cira ṭṭhita ttham dhammassa karontena mayā imaṃ
translated: By me who has done this for the long-lasting benefit of the Dhamma,

original: Saddhammabahumānena, yañca puññaṃ samācitaṃ;
analyzed: saddhamma bahu mānena yat ca puññam samācitam
translated: And whatever merit has been accumulated through great respect for the true Dhamma,

original: Sabbassa ānubhāvena, tassa sabbepi pāṇino;
analyzed: sabbassa ānubhāvena tassa sabbe api pāṇinaḥ
translated: By the power of all that, may all living beings,

original: Bhavantu dhammarājassa, saddhammarasasevino.
analyzed: bhavantu dhammarājassa saddhamma rasa sevino
translated: May they be for the righteous king, who is devoted to the true Dhamma.

original: Ciraṃ tiṭṭhatu saddhammo, kāle vassaṃ ciraṃ pajaṃ;
analyzed: ciram tiṭṭhatu saddhammaḥ kāle vassam ciram pajam
translated: May the true Dhamma long endure, may the rain fall in due season, and may the people be happy;

original: Tappetu devo dhammena, rājā rakkhatu mediniṃ.
analyzed: tappetu devaḥ dhammena rājā rakkhatu medinim
translated: May the king, in accordance with the Dhamma, protect the land.

original: Tāva tiṭṭhatu lokasmiṃ, lokanittharaṇesinaṃ;
analyzed: tāva tiṭṭhatu lokasmim loka nittharaṇa īsinam
translated: May the Dhamma of the Buddha, the one who has crossed the ocean of existence,

original: Dassentī kulaputtānaṃ, nayaṃ sīlavisuddhiyā;🔽Yāva buddhoti nāmampi, suddhacittassa tādino;
analyzed: dassentī kula puttānam nayam sīla visuddhiyā  yāva buddhaḥ ti nāmam pi suddhacittassa tādinaḥ
translated: Which shows the way to purity of virtue to the sons of noble families, long endure in the world.🔽As long as the name “Buddha” endures in the world,

original: Lokamhi lokajeṭṭhassa, pavattati mahesino.
analyzed: lokamhi loka jeṭṭhassa pavattati mahesinaḥ
translated: Of the one of pure mind, the great sage, the eldest of the world,

original: Karuṇāsītalahadayaṃ, paññāpajjotavihatamohatamaṃ;
analyzed: karuṇā sīta lahadayam
translated: I have paid homage to the Sugata, whose heart is cool with compassion, who has dispelled the darkness of delusion with the light of wisdom,

original: Sanarāmaralokagaruṃ, vande sugataṃ gativimuttaṃ.
analyzed: sa nara amara loka garum vande sugatam gati vimuttam
translated: Who is revered by the world of men and gods, who is free from all states of existence.

original: Buddhopi buddhabhāvaṃ, bhāvetvā ceva sacchikatvāca;
analyzed: buddhaḥ api buddha bhāvam bhāvetvā ca iva sacchikatvā ca
translated: The Buddha, having developed and realized the state of Buddhahood,

original: Yaṃ upagato gatamalaṃ, vande tamanuttaraṃ dhammaṃ.🔽Sugatassa orasānaṃ, puttānaṃ mārasenamathanānaṃ;
analyzed: yam upagataḥ gata malam vande tam anuttaram dhammam  sugatassa orasānam puttānam māra sena mathanānam
translated: To which he went, being free from defilements, I pay homage to that unsurpassed Dhamma.🔽I pay homage with my head to the eight assemblies of the noble Sangha,

original: Aṭṭhannampi samūhaṃ, sirasā vande ariyasaṅghaṃ.
analyzed: samūham sirasā vande ariya saṅgham
translated: The sons of the Sugata, the conquerors of Mara’s army.

original: Dīghassa dīghasuttaṅkitassa, nipuṇassa āgamavarassa;
analyzed: dīghassa dīghasuttaṅkitassa nipuṇassa āgama varassa
translated: To the long, long sutta, the subtle, the best of the Agamas,

original: Buddhānubuddhasaṃvaṇṇitassa, saddhāvahaguṇassa.
analyzed: buddha anubuddha saṃvaṇṇitassa saddhā vaha guṇassa
translated: The virtue that brings faith, praised by Buddhas and Paccekabuddhas.

original: Sammāsambuddheneva hi tiṇṇampi piṭakānaṃ atthavaṇṇanākkamo bhāsito, yāpakiṇṇakadesanāti vuccati, tato saṃgāyanādivasena sāvakehīti ācariyā vadanti.
analyzed: sammāsambuddhena iva hi tiṇṇam pi piṭakānam attha vaṇṇanā kkamaḥ bhāsito yā apakiṇṇaka desanā ti vuccati tatas saṃgāyana ādi vasena sāvakehi iti ācariyāḥ vadanti
translated: For the order in which the three Piṭakas are expounded was spoken by the Fully Enlightened One himself, and it is called the “dispersed teaching.” After that, the disciples expounded it by means of the recitation in the First Council, etc., say the teachers.

original: Atthappakāsanatthaṃ, aṭṭhakathā ādito vasisatehi;
analyzed: attha ppakāsana attham aṭṭhakathā āditaḥ vasi satehi
translated: The commentaries were begun for the purpose of elucidating the meaning,

original: Pañcahi yāsaṅgītā, anusaṅgītā ca pacchāpi.🔽Majjhe visuddhimaggā, esa catunnampi āgamānañhi;
analyzed: ca pacchā api  majjhe visuddhi maggā catunnam pi āgamānam hi
translated: By five hundred and five hundred, respectively, and later by Yasa.🔽In the middle, the Path of Purification,

original: Ṭhatvā pakāsayissati, tattha yathā bhāsitamatthaṃ;
analyzed: ṭhatvā pakāsayissati tattha yathā bhāsitam attham
translated: Will stand and elucidate the meaning of all four Piṭakas.

original: Icceva kato tasmā, tampi gahetvāna saddhimetāya;
analyzed: idcā iva kataḥ tasmā saddhim etāya
translated: Therefore, having taken that, together with this commentary,

original: Aṭṭhakathāya vijānātha, dīghāgamanissitaṃ atthaṃ.
analyzed: aṭṭhakathāya vijānātha dīgha āgama nissitam attham
translated: Understand the meaning dependent on the Digha Piṭaka.

original: Atthānaṃ sūcanato, suvuttato savanatothasūdanato,
analyzed: atthānam sūcanataḥ su vuttataḥ savana to tha sūdanataḥ
translated: Because it shows the meaning, because it is well spoken, because it is the tradition, because it is the commentary,

original: Suttāṇā suttasabhāgatoca, suttanti akkhātaṃ.
analyzed: suttāṇā sutta sabhāgato ca suttanti akkhātam
translated: Because it is the collection of discourses, and because it is the discourse, the discourse is declared.

original: Sududdasaṃ sunipuṇaṃ, yatthakāmanipātinaṃ;
analyzed: su duddasam su nipuṇam yattha kāma nipātinam
translated: Difficult to see, very subtle,

original: Cittaṃ rakkhetha medhāvī, cittaṃ guttaṃ sukhāvahaṃ.
analyzed: cittam rakkhetha medhāvī cittam guttam sukha āvaham
translated: The wise one should guard the mind, the guarded mind brings happiness.

original: So evaṃ samāhite citte parisuddhe pariyodāte anaṅgaṇe vigatūpakkilese mudubhūte kammaniye ṭhite ānañjappatte ñāṇadassanāya cittaṃ abhinīharati abhininnāmeti –
analyzed: saḥ evam samāhite citte parisuddhe pariyodāte anaṅgaṇe vigata upakkilese mudu bhūte kammaniye ṭhite ānañja ppatte ñāṇa dassanāya cittam abhinīharati abhininnāma iti
translated: When his concentrated mind was thus purified, bright, unblemished, free from imperfection, malleable, wieldy, steady, and attained to imperturbability, he directed it to knowledge of the destruction of the taints.

original: Yaṃhitaṃ bhikkhave sammāvadamāne vadeyya samantapāso mārassāti, mātugāmaṃyeva sammā vadamāno vadeyya samantapāso mārassāti.
analyzed: yaṃhitam bhikkhave sammā vadamāne vadeyya samanta pāsaḥ mārassa ati mātugāmaṃyā iva sammā vadamānaḥ vadeyya samanta pāsaḥ mārassa ati
translated: If one could rightly say of anything: “A snare spread out by Mara,” it is of women that one could rightly say this.

original: Yo bhikkhu divasaṃ caṅkamena nisajjāya ca āvaraṇīyehi dhammehi cittaṃ parisodhetvā.
analyzed: yaḥ bhikkhu divasam caṅkamena nisajjāya ca āvaraṇīyehi dhammehi cittam parisodhetvā
translated: The bhikkhu who has purified his mind of hindrances,

original: Iti cittakiriyavāyodhātuvipphāravasena ayaṃ kāyasammato aṭṭhisaṅghāto abhikkamati.

translated: “Our Blessed One has made his aspiration, and in the interval not even one Buddha has arisen in a single aeon.”

original: nāma natthīti evamādinā bhante aṭṭhakathācariyena kathito.
analyzed: nāma natthi iti evamādinā bhante aṭṭhakathā cariyena kathitaḥ
translated: This is how the teacher of the commentary has explained it.

original: Vipassissa bhikkhave bhagavato ito so bhikkhave chanavutikappe yaṃ vipassī bhagavā arahaṃ sammāsambuddho loke udapādi –
analyzed: vipassissa bhikkhave bhagavataḥ itas saḥ bhikkhave chanavuti kappe yam vipassī bhagavā araham sammāsambuddhaḥ loke udapādi
translated: “Bhikkhus, ninety-one aeons ago the Blessed One Vipassi arose in the world.🔽“The good aeon” is so called because it is adorned with five Buddhas.

original: Saddakappeti pañcabuddhuppādapaṭimaṇḍitattā sundarakappe sārakappeti bhagavā imaṃ kappaṃ thomento evamāha –
analyzed: sadda kappe iti pañca buddha uppāda paṭimaṇḍita ttā sundara kappe sāra kappe iti bhagavā imam kappam thomentaḥ evam āha
translated: “The essential aeon” is so called because the Blessed One extols this aeon thus:

original: “Yato paṭṭhāya kira amhākaṃ bhagavatābhinīhāro kato, etasmiṃ antare ekasmimpi kappe pañcabuddhā nibbattā nāma natthi” –
analyzed: yatas paṭṭhāya kira amhākam bhagavatā abhinīhāro kato etasmin antare ekasmim pi kappe pañcabuddhāḥ nibbattāḥ nāma natthi
translated: “Since our Blessed One made his aspiration, not even one Buddha has arisen in the interval of a single aeon.”

original: Āyuparicchedavāra
analyzed: āyu pariccheda vāra
translated: The section on the delimitation of life-span

original: Pucchā – catutthe panāvuso āyuparicchedavāre appaṃ vā bhiyyoti etesaṃ padānaṃ attho kathaṃ aṭṭhakathācariyena kathito.
analyzed: pucchā catutthe pana āvuso āyu pariccheda vāre appam vā bhiyyo ti etesam padānam attho katham aṭṭhakathā cariyena kathito
translated: Question: But, friend, how has the teacher of the commentary explained the meaning of the words “little or much” in the fourth section on the delimitation of life-span?

original: Vissajjanā – catutthe pana bhante āyuparicchedavāre appaṃ vā bhiyyoti etesaṃ padānaṃ🔽attho “appaṃ vā bhiyyoti vassasatato vā upari appaṃ, aññaṃ vassasataṃ apatvā vīsaṃ🔽vā tiṃsaṃ vā cattālīsaṃ vā paṇṇāsaṃ vā saṭṭhi vā vassāni jīvati. Evaṃ dīghāyuko pana
analyzed: vissajjanā catutthe pana bhante āyu pariccheda vāre appam vā bhiyyo ti etesam padānam  attho appam vā bhiyyo ti vassa satataḥ vā upari appam aññam vassa satam a patvā vīsam  vā tiṃsam vā cattālīsam vā paṇṇāsam vā saṭṭhi vā vassāni jīvati evam dīgha āyukaḥ pana
translated: The answer: In the fourth section, “limited or unlimited,” the meaning of the terms

original: atidullabho, asuko kira evaṃ ciraṃ jīvatīti tattha tattha gantvā daṭṭhabbo hotī”ti
analyzed: ati dullabhaḥ asukaḥ kira evam ciram jīvati iti tattha tattha gantvā daṭṭhabbo hoti iti
translated: “limited or unlimited” is this: “Limited” means less than a hundred years. One lives for twenty, thirty, forty, fifty, or sixty years. But one who lives so long is very rare. People say, “He is long-lived, I hear. He must be seen.”

original: evamādinā bhante tattha aṭṭhakathācariyena kathito.
analyzed: evamādinā bhante tattha aṭṭhakathā cariyena kathito
translated: The explanation given by the teachers of the commentary is as follows.

original: Mayhaṃ bhikkhave etarahi appakaṃ āyuppamāṇaṃ parittaṃ lahukaṃ yo ciraṃ jīvati so vassasataṃ appaṃ vā bhiyyo.
analyzed: mayham bhikkhave etarahi appakam āyu ppamāṇam parittam lahukam yaḥ ciram jīvati saḥ vassa satam appam vā bhiyyas
translated: “Bhikkhus, my life-span is now limited, short, brief, brief is the life of mortals. One who lives long lives for a hundred years or a little more.

original: Appaṃ vā bhiyyoti vassasatato vā upari appaṃ, ayyaṃ vassasataṃ apatvā vīsaṃ vā tiṃsaṃ vā cattālīsaṃvā vā paṇṇāsaṃ vā saṭṭhi vā vassāni jīvati–
analyzed: appam vā bhiyyoti vassa satataḥ vā upari appam ayyam vassa satam a patvā vīsam vā tiṃsam vā cattālīsam vā vā paṇṇāsam vā saṭṭhi vā vassāni jīvati
translated: “Limited” means less than a hundred years. One lives for twenty, thirty, forty, fifty, or sixty years.

original: Upaṭṭhākaparicchedavāra
analyzed: upaṭṭhāka pariccheda vāra
translated: The section on the limit of service

original: Pucchā – aṭṭhame panāvuso upaṭṭhākaparicchedavāre ānandotipade kathaṃ aṭṭhakathācariyena vaṇṇito.
analyzed: pucchā aṭṭhame pana āvuso upaṭṭhāka pariccheda vāre ānanda uti pade katham aṭṭhakathā cariyena vaṇṇito
translated: Question: But, reverend Sir, in the eighth section on the Requisites of a Personal Attendant, in the words “Ānanda”, how was the teacher of the commentary praised?

original: Vissajjanā – aṭṭhame pana bhante upaṭṭhākaparicchede pana ānandoti nibaddhupaṭṭhākabhāvaṃ sandhāya vuttanti evamādinā bhante aṭṭhakathācariyena vaṇṇito.
analyzed: vissajjanā aṭṭhame pana bhante upaṭṭhāka paricchede pana ānandaḥ ti nibaddha upaṭṭhāka bhāvam sandhāya vuttan ti evamādinā bhante aṭṭhakathā cariyena vaṇṇito
translated: Answer: But, reverend Sir, in the eighth section on the Requisites of a Personal Attendant, in the words “Ānanda”, it was said with reference to the state of being a permanent attendant, and so on, reverend Sir, the teacher of the commentary was praised.

original: Mayhaṃ bhikkhave etarahi ānando nāma bhikkhu upaṭṭhāko ahosi aggupaṭṭhāko–
analyzed: mayham bhikkhave etarahi ānandaḥ nāma bhikkhu upaṭṭhākaḥ ahosi agga upaṭṭhāko
translated: “Monks, at present my attendant monk is the monk named Ānanda, he is my chief attendant.

original: Bhagavatohi paṭhamabodhiyaṃ anibaddhā upaṭṭhākā ahesuṃ.
analyzed: bhagavataḥ hi paṭhama bodhiyam a nibaddhāḥ upaṭṭhākāḥ ahesuṃ
translated: For the Fortunate One, in the first stage of Awakening, there were no permanent attendants.

original: Ekadā nāgasamālo pattacīvaraṃ gahetvā vicari.
analyzed: ekadā nāga samālaḥ patta cīvaram gahetvā vicari
translated: Sometimes Nāgasamāla, after taking the bowl and robe, wandered for alms.

original: Idameva te kāraṇaṃ sallakkhetvā nivārayimha.
analyzed: idam eva te kāraṇam nivārayimha
translated: We stopped him after considering this very reason.

original: Ekacce bhikkhū iminā maggena gacchāmāti vutte aññena gacchanti.
analyzed: ekacce bhikkhū iminā maggena gacchāma iti vutte aññena gacchanti
translated: Some monks, when it was said: “We will go by this road”, went by another road.

original: Uṭṭhehi āvuso ānanda, uṭṭhehi āvuso ānanda.🔽Kaṃ panettha ānanda ādīnavaṃ passasi.
analyzed: uṭṭhehi āvuso ānanda uṭṭhehi āvuso ānanda  kam pana ittha ānanda ādīnavam passasi
translated: “Rise up, friend Ānanda, rise up, friend Ānanda.🔽But what danger do you see here, Ānanda?

original: Kaṃ panettha ānanda ānisaṃsaṃ passasi.
analyzed: kam pana ittha ānanda ānisaṃsam passasi
translated: But what benefit do you see here, Ānanda?”

original: Samavattakkhandho atulo, suppabuddho ca uttaro;
analyzed: samavatta kkhandhaḥ atulaḥ suppabuddhaḥ ca uttaraḥ
translated: The one with the rounded shoulders, the matchless one, the well-awakened one, the supreme one,

original: Sattavāho vijitaseno, rāhulo bhavati sattamo –
analyzed: satta vāhaḥ vijita senaḥ rāhulaḥ bhavati sattamaḥ
translated: The one with the seven horses, the one with the conquered army, and Rahula is the seventh.

original: Sutanā sabbakāmāca, sucittā atha rocinī;
analyzed: sutanā sabbakāmā ca sucittā atha rocinī
translated: Sutanā, Sabbakāmā, Sucittā, and then Rocinī,

original: Rucaggatī sunandāca, bimbā bhavati sattamā.
analyzed: rucaggatī sunandā ca bimbā bhavati sattamā
translated: Rucaggatī, Sunandā, and Bimbā is the seventh.

original: Anekajātisaṃsāraṃ, sandhāvissaṃ anibbisaṃ;
analyzed: aneka jāti saṃsāram sandhāvissam anibbisam
translated: For so long as I wandered through the cycle of rebirths, not knowing the builder,

original: Gahakāraṃ gavesanto, dukkhā jāti punappunaṃ;
analyzed: gahakāram gavesantaḥ dukkhā jāti punappunam
translated: Seeking birth and death, again and again, suffering.

original: Gahakāraka diṭṭhosi, puna gehaṃ na kāhasi.
analyzed: gahakāraka diṭṭhaḥ asi puna geham na
translated: O builder of the house, you are seen! You will not build the house again.

original: Sabbā te phāsukā bhaggā, gahakūṭaṃ visaṅkhataṃ;
analyzed: sabbā te phāsukā bhaggā gaha kūṭam visaṅkhatam
translated: All your rafters are broken, your ridgepole is shattered.

original: Visaṅkhāragataṃ cittaṃ, taṇhānaṃ khayamajjhagā.🔽Ayoghanahatasseva, jalato jātavedaso;
analyzed: visaṅkhāra gatam cittam taṇhānam khaya majjhagā  ayaḥ ghana hatassa iva jalataḥ jātavedaso
translated: My mind has reached the unconditioned, and attained the destruction of craving.🔽Just as the course of a burning,🔽flaming log of wood is not known

original: Anupubbūpasantassa, yathā na ñāñate gati;🔽Evaṃ sammāvimuttānaṃ, kāmabandhoghatārinaṃ;
analyzed: anupubbūpasantassa yathā na gati  evam sammā vimuttānam kāma bandha ogha tārinam
translated: when it is gradually extinguished,🔽so there is no known course🔽for those who are rightly liberated,🔽who have crossed over the flood of sensual pleasures,

original: Paññāpetuṃ gati natthi, pattānaṃ acalaṃ sukhaṃ.
analyzed: paññāpetum gati natthi pattānam acalam sukham
translated: who have attained the unshakable bliss.

original: Na pana bhagavā milakkhusadiso hoti nāpi āmuttamaṇikuṇḍalo.
analyzed: na pana bhagavā milakkhu sadisaḥ hoti na api āmutta maṇi kuṇḍalo
translated: But the Blessed One is not like a barbarian, nor does he have a dangling earring.

original: Te pana attano samānasaṇṭhānameva passanti.
analyzed: te pana attano samāna saṇṭhānam eva passanti
translated: But they see only their own appearance.

original: Na kho ānanda ettāvatā tathāgato sakkato vā hoti garukato vā mānito vā pūjito vā apacito vā.
analyzed: na kho ānanda ettāvatā tathāgataḥ sakkataḥ vā hoti garukataḥ vā mānitaḥ vā pūjitaḥ vā apacitaḥ vā
translated: “But it is not by this that a Realised One is honoured, respected, revered, worshipped, or esteemed.

original: Kasmā pana bhagavā aññattha ekaṃ umāpupphamattampi gahetvā buddha guṇe āvajjetvā katāya pūjāya buddhañāṇenāpi aparicchinnaṃ vipākaṃ vaṇṇetvā–
analyzed: kasmā pana bhagavā aññattha ekam umā puppha mattam pi gahetvā buddha guṇe āvajjetvā katāya pūjāya buddha ñāṇena api aparicchinnam vipākam vaṇṇetvā
translated: But why did the Fortunate One, after taking even a single UMPP flower elsewhere, and recollecting the Buddha’s qualities, after praising the worship that was made, and after describing the result that was not even measured by the Buddha’s knowledge, saying:

original: Yo kho ānanda bhikkhu vā bhikkhunī vā upāsako vā upāsikā vā dhammānudhammappaṭipanno🔽viharati sāmīcippaṭipanno anudhammacārī so tathā gataṃ sakkaroti garukaroti māneti
analyzed: yaḥ kho ānanda bhikkhu vā bhikkhunī vā upāsakaḥ vā upāsikā vā dhamma anudhamma paṭipannaḥ  viharati sāmīci paṭipannaḥ anudhamma cārī saḥ tathā gatam sakkaroti garukaroti māneti
translated: “Whoever, Ānanda, a monk or nun or layman or laywoman, lives practising the Dhamma in accordance with the Dhamma,

original: pūjeti apaciyati paramāya –
analyzed: pūjā iti paramāya
translated: practising the austere practice, living in conformity with the Dhamma, he or she honours, respects, reveres, worships, and esteems the Realised One with the highest esteem.🔽He or she is one who truly worships me, Ānanda, with the highest worship.

original: Siyā kho panānanda tumhākaṃ evamassa ‘atītasatthukaṃ pāvacanaṃ, natthi no satthā’ti.
analyzed: siyā kho pana ānanda tumhākam evam assa atīta satthukam pāvacanam natthi no satthā ati
translated: It may be, Ānanda, that you think thus: ‘The Teacher’s instruction has been transcended, we are without a protector, we are without a refuge.’

original: Na kho panetaṃ ānanda evaṃ daṭṭhabbaṃ.
analyzed: na kho pana itam ānanda evam daṭṭhabbam
translated: But it should not be seen like this, Ānanda.

original: Dhammopi desito ceva paññattoca, vinayopi desito ceva paññatto ca–
analyzed: dhammo api desito ca iva paññatto ca vinayaḥ api desito ca iva paññatto ca
translated: The Dhamma and the Discipline have been taught by me, and the Teacher’s instruction has not been transcended, you have a protector, you have a refuge.

original: Assosi kho rājā māgadho ajātasattu vedehiputto bhagavā kira kusinārāyaṃ parinibbutoti.🔽Satthā nāma parinibbuto, na so sakkā puna āharituṃ, pothujjanikasaddhāya pana amhākaṃ
analyzed: assosi kho rājā māgadhaḥ ajātasattu vedehi putto bhagavā kira kusinārāyam parinibbutaḥ ti  satthā nāma parinibbutaḥ na saḥ sakkā puna āharitum pothujjanika saddhāya pana amhākam
translated: The King of Magadha, Ajatasattu, son of the Videhi Queen, heard that the Lord had attained final Nibbana in Kusinara.

original: raññā sadiso natthi, sace esa imināva niyāmena suṇissati, hadayamassa phalissati.
analyzed: raññā sadisaḥ natthi sace esaḥ iminā ava niyāmena suṇissati hadayam assa phalissati
translated: The Teacher has attained final Nibbana, and he cannot be brought back again. But if he hears this in the way that he is going to hear it, his heart will burst.

original: Rājā kho pana amhehi anurakkhitabboti.
analyzed: rājā kho pana amhehi anurakkhitabbaḥ ti
translated: And the king must be protected by us.

original: Deva amhehi supinako diṭṭho, tassa paṭighātatthaṃ tumhehi dukūladupaṭṭaṃ nivāsetvā yathā nāsāpuṭamattaṃ paññāyati, evaṃ catumadhuradoṇiyā nipajjituṃ vaṭṭatīti.
analyzed: deva amhehi supinakaḥ diṭṭho tassa paṭighāta attham tumhehi dukūla dupaṭṭam nivāsetvā yathā nāsā puṭa mattam paññāyati evam catu madhura doṇiyā nipajjitum vaṭṭati iti
translated: Sire, we have had a dream, and for the purpose of averting its evil we must dress you in a garment of felt, and you must lie down in a trough of oil so that only your nose protrudes.

original: Deva maraṇato muccanakasatto nāma natthi, amhākaṃ āyuvaḍḍhano cetiyaṭṭhānaṃ puññakkhettaṃ abhisekasiñcako so bhagavā satthā kusinārāya parinibbutoti.
analyzed: deva maraṇataḥ muccanakasatto nāma natthi amhākam cetiya ṭṭhānam puñña khettam abhiseka siñcako so bhagavā satthā kusinārāya parinibbuto ti
translated: Sire, there is no being that can escape from death. Our place of worship, which increases our life span, is a field of merit. The Lord, the anointed, the Teacher, has attained final Nibbana in Kusinara.

original: Bhagavā sabbaññu nanu imasmiṃ ṭhāne nisīditvā dhammaṃ desayittha, sokasallaṃ me vinodayittha,
analyzed: bhagavā sabbaññu nanu imasmin ṭhāne nisīditvā dhammam desayittha soka sallam me vinodayittha
translated: Did not the Omniscient One sit down here and teach the Dhamma, and remove the dart of sorrow?

original: tumhe mayhaṃ sokasallaṃ nīharittha, ahaṃ tumhākaṃ saraṇaṃ gato, idāni pana me paṭivacanampi na detha bhagavāti.
analyzed: tumhe mayham soka sallam aham tumhākam saraṇam gataḥ idāni pana me paṭivacanam pi na detha bhagavā ti
translated: You have removed the dart of sorrow from me. I have gone for refuge to you. But now you will not give me a reply.”

original: Nanu bhagavā ahaṃ aññadā evarūpe kāle tumhe mahābhikkhu saṅghaparivārā jambudīpatale cārikaṃ carathāti suṇomi.
analyzed: nanu bhagavā aham aññadā evarūpe kāle tumhe mahā bhikkhu saṅgha parivārāḥ jambudīpa tale cārikam caratha ati suṇomi
translated: “Did I not hear you say on other occasions, ‘At such a time I will go on a pilgrimage over the earth with a great company of monks’?

original: Mama parideviteneva na sijjhati, dasabalassa dhātuyo āharāpessāmīti evaṃ assosi.
analyzed: mama paridevitena iva na sijjhati dasabalassa dhātuyaḥ āhara āpessāmi iti evam assosi
translated: “It is not because of my lamentations that you do not get them. I will bring you the relics of the One of Ten Powers.” So he said, and he made the necessary preparations.

original: Sace dassanti, sundaraṃ. No ce dassanti, āharaṇupāyena āharissāmīti caturaṅginiṃ senaṃ sannayhitvā sayampi nikkhantoyeva.
analyzed: sace dassanti sundaram no ce dassanti āharaṇa upāyena āharissāmi iti caturaṅginim senam sannayhitvā sayam pi
translated: “If they give them, well and good. If not, I will take them by force.” So saying, he equipped an army of four divisions and set out himself.

original: Yathā ca ajātasattu, evaṃ licchavī ādayopi.
analyzed: yathā ca ajātasattu evam licchavī ādayaḥ api
translated: And just as Ajātasattu did, so did the Licchavīs and the others.

original: Amhākaṃ dhātuyo vā dentu, yuddhaṃ vāti kusinārānagaraṃ parivāretvā ṭhite etaṃ bhagavā amhākaṃ gāmakkhettehi paṭivacanaṃ avocuṃ.
analyzed: amhākam dhātuyaḥ vā dentu yuddham vā ati kusinārā nagaram parivāretvā ṭhite etam bhagavā amhākam gāma khettehi paṭivacanam avocuṃ
translated: “Either give us the relics or fight,” they said, and they surrounded the city of Kusinārā. The Blessed One replied to them from the midst of the village.

original: Na mayaṃ satthu sāsanaṃ pahiṇimha, nāpi gantvā ānayimha. Satthā pana sayameva āgantvā
analyzed: na mayam satthu sāsanam pahiṇimha na api gantvā ānayimha satthā pana sayam eva āgantvā
translated: “We did not send for the Teacher, nor did we go and fetch him. The Teacher came of his own accord.

original: sāsanaṃ pesetvā amhe pakkosāpesi. Tumhepi kho pana yaṃ tumhākaṃ gāmakkhette ratanaṃ
analyzed: sāsanam pesetvā amhe pakkosāpesi tumhe pi kho pana yam tumhākam gāma khette ratanam
translated: and sent a message to us to summon us. And you, whatever treasure there is in your village-field,

original: uppajjati. Na taṃ amhākaṃ detha. Sadevake ca loke buddharatanasamaṃ ratanaṃ nāma
analyzed: uppajjati na tam amhākam detha sa devake ca loke buddha ratana samam ratanam nāma
translated: and sent a message to us, saying: ‘Whatever treasure arises in your realm, you must not give to us. There is no treasure in the world with its gods equal to the Buddha-treasure,

original: natthi, evarūpaṃ uttamaratanaṃ labhitvā mayaṃ nadassāma, na kho pana tumhehiyeva
analyzed: na atthi evarūpam uttama ratanam labhitvā mayam nadassāma na kho pana
translated: and having obtained such a supreme treasure we will not give it up. But it is not only you who have drunk milk from your mother’s breast,

original: mātuthanato khīraṃ pītaṃ. Amhehipi mātuthanato khīraṃ pītaṃ, na tumheyeva purisā,
analyzed: mātu thanataḥ khīram pītam amhehi pi mātu thanataḥ khīram pītam na tumheya iva purisā
translated: we too have drunk milk from our mother’s breast, and you are not the only men,

original: amhepi purisā. Hotūti aññamaññaṃ ahaṃkāraṃ katvā sāsanapaṭisāsanaṃ pesenti. Aññamaññaṃ
analyzed: amhe pi purisāḥ hotu uti aññam aññam ahaṃkāram katvā sāsana paṭisāsanam pesenti aññam aññam
translated: we too are men. Let it be!’ and they sent messages to each other, and they roared at each other

original: mānagajjitaṃ gajjanti.
analyzed: māna gajjitam gajjanti
translated: with their mutual pride.

original: Ete rājāno bhagavato parinibbutaṭṭhāne vivādaṃ karonti, na kho panetaṃ patirūpaṃ, alaṃ iminā kalahena, vūpasamessāmi nanti.
analyzed: ete rājānaḥ bhagavataḥ parinibbuta ṭṭhāne vivādam karonti na kho pana etat patirūpam alam iminā kalahena vūpasamessāmi
translated: These kings are arguing about the place where the Fortunate One attained Final Emancipation, but it is not right, it is not proper, it is not suitable, it is not worthy of the Noble Ones, it is not allowable, it is not to be done, that they should argue about the place where the Fortunate One attained Final Emancipation, it is not right to argue about the place where the Fortunate One attained Final Emancipation,🔽let us go to the place where the Fortunate One attained Final Emancipation, and there we will settle the matter without arguing, without disputing, without quarrelling, in concord, in amity, in harmony, with a common recitation.’

original: Ācariyassa viya bho saddo, ācariyassa viya bho saddoti sabbe niravā ahesuṃ.
analyzed: ācariyassa viya bho saddo ācariyassa viya bho saddo ti sabbe niravāḥ ahesuṃ
translated: Just as the sound of a teacher, just as the sound of a teacher, they all became silent.

original: Suṇantu bhonto mama ekavācaṃ,

translated: “For a long time, reverend Sir, I have wanted to come to see the Fortunate One, but I have been prevented by the many duties and responsibilities of the Tāvatiṃsa devas, and so I have not been able to come to see the Fortunate One.

original: Te “tava santakā, mama santakā”ti nicchetuṃ asakkontā aḍḍaṃ karonti, sakkaṃ devarājānaṃ pucchanti, so “yassa vimānaṃ āsannataraṃ, tassa santakā”ti vadati.🔽Yassa vimānaṃ olokentī ṭhitā, tassa santakāti vadati.
analyzed: te tava santakāḥ mama santakā iti nicchetum a sakkontāḥ aḍḍam karonti sakkam devarājānam pucchanti saḥ yassa vimānam āsannataram tassa santakā iti vadati 🔽yassa vimānaṃ olokentī ṭhitā tassa santakā iti vadati
translated: They are unable to decide, saying: ‘Yours, yours!’ and they make a dispute, and they ask Sakka, the Lord of the Gods, and he says: ‘They are yours, of the one whose palace is nearer.’🔽She says: ‘They are yours, of the one whose palace I was looking at when I stood there.’

original: Idheva bhante kapilavatthusmiṃ gopikā nāma sakyadhītā ahosi buddhe pasannā dhamme
analyzed: idha iva bhante kapilavatthusmim gopikā nāma sakya dhītā ahosi buddhe pasannā dhamme
translated: Here in Kapilavatthu, Lord, there was a Sakyan lady called Gopikā who had faith in the Buddha, the Dhamma and the Sangha,

original: pasannā saṅghe pasannā sīlesu paripūrakārinī, sā itthittaṃ virājetvā purisattaṃ bhāvetvā
analyzed: pasannā saṅghe pasannā sīlesu paripūra kārinī sā itthittam virājetvā purisattam bhāvetvā
translated: and who had fulfilled her moral duties. She, having renounced the female form and developed the male form,

original: kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā sugatiṃ saggaṃ lokaṃ upapannā.🔽Tassa dhammassa pattiyā, āgatamhāsi mārisa;
analyzed: kāyassa bhedā param maraṇā sugatim saggam lokam upapannā  tassa dhammassa pattiyā āgatamhā asi mārisa
translated: at the breaking-up of the body after death, was reborn in a good place, a heavenly world.🔽For the sake of that Dhamma, Lord, we have come here;

original: Katāvakāsā bhagavatā, pañhaṃ pucchemu mārisa.
analyzed: kata avakāsāḥ bhagavatā pañham pucchemu mārisa
translated: having received leave from the Lord, we would ask a question, Lord.

original: Puccha vāsava maṃ pañhaṃ, yaṃ kiñci manasicchasi;
analyzed: puccha vāsava mam pañham yam kiñci manasi icchasi
translated: Ask, Vāsava, whatever question you wish;

original: Tassa tasseva pañhassa, ahaṃ antaṃ karomi te.
analyzed: tassa tassa iva pañhassa aham antam karomi te
translated: I will satisfy your mind with just that answer.

original: Kiṃ saṃyojanā nu kho mārisa devā manussā asurā nāgā gandhabbā ye caññe santi puthukāyā,
analyzed: kim saṃyojanā nu kho mārisa devāḥ manussāḥ asurāḥ nāgāḥ gandhabbāḥ ye caññe santi puthu kāyā
translated: What, Lord, is the fetter of gods, men, asuras, nāgas, gandhabbas and whatever other beings there are,🔽that they live hating, insulting, taunting, scorning, quarrelling, disputing, arguing, and speaking words that are rough and hurtful, and that they live with their minds full of hate?

original: te averā adaṇḍā asapattā abyāpajjā viharemu averinoti iti ca nesaṃ hoti. Atha ca🔽pana saverā sadaṇḍā sasapattā sabyāpajjā viharanti saverinoti.
analyzed: te a verāḥ a daṇḍāḥ a sa pattāḥ a byāpajjāḥ viharemu iti ca na isam hoti atha ca 🔽pana sa verā sa daṇḍā sa sa pattā sa byāpajjā viharanti
translated: But they think: ‘May we live without hate, without rod, without violence, with our minds full of love.’

original: Issāmacchariyasaṃyojanā kho devānaminda devā manussā asurā nāgā gandhabbā yecaññe
analyzed: kho devānaminda devāḥ manussāḥ asurāḥ nāgāḥ gandhabbāḥ yecaññe
translated: The fetter of envy and avarice, Devānaminda, is in devas, humans, asuras, nāgas, gandhabbas, and whatever other🔽beings there are of various kinds.

original: santi puthukāyā, te averā adaṇḍā asapattā abyāpajjā viharemu averinoti iti ca nesaṃhoti,
analyzed: santi te a verāḥ a daṇḍāḥ a sapattāḥ a byāpajjāḥ viharemu iti ca
translated: They think: ‘May we live free from hatred, free from ill-will, free from affliction,’

original: atha ca pana saverā sadaṇḍā sasapattā sabyāpajjā viharanti saverinoti.
analyzed: atha ca pana sa verā sa daṇḍā sa sa pattā sa byāpajjā viharanti
translated: but they live with hatred, ill-will, and affliction.

original: Issatīti issā, sā parasampattīnaṃ usūyanalakkhaṇā, tattheva anabhiratirasā, tato vimukhabhāvapaccupaṭṭhānā, parasampatti padaṭṭhānā, saṃyojananti daṭṭhabbā.
analyzed: issati iti issā sā para sampattīnam usūyana lakkhaṇā tattha eva anabhirati rasā tatas vimukha bhāva paccupaṭṭhānā para sampatti padaṭṭhānā saṃyojanan ti daṭṭhabbā
translated: Envy is envy of others’ success; its characteristic is to be discontented with others’ success; the taste is the same; its manifestation is the desire to be free of that; its footing is others’ success; it should be regarded as a fetter.

original: Maccherabhāvo macchariyaṃ, taṃladdhānaṃ vā labhitabbānaṃ vā attano sampattīnaṃ nigūhanalakkhaṇaṃ,
analyzed: maccherabhāvaḥ macchariyam tad laddhānam vā labhitabbānam vā attanaḥ sampattīnam nigūhana lakkhaṇam
translated: Avarice is the state of being avaricious; its characteristic is the concealment of one’s own success, whether gained or to be gained;

original: tāsaṃyeva parehi sādhāraṇabhāva akkhamanarasaṃ, saṅkocanapaccupaṭṭhānaṃ, kaṭukañcukatā
analyzed: tāsam yeva parehi sādhāraṇa bhāva akkhamana rasam saṅkocana paccupaṭṭhānam kaṭu kañcuka tā
translated: its taste is the inability to bear sharing it with others; its manifestation is contraction;

original: paccupaṭṭhānaṃ vā, attasampattipadaṭṭhānaṃ, cetaso virūpabhāvoti daṭṭhabbaṃ.
analyzed: paccupaṭṭhānam vā atta sampatti padaṭṭhānam cetasaḥ virūpa bhāvaḥ ti daṭṭhabbam
translated: its footing is one’s own success; it should be regarded as the mind’s ugliness.

original: Kiṃ vaṇṇo esoti taṃ taṃ dosaṃ vadanto pariyattiñca kassaci kiñci adento dubbaṇṇo ceva eḷamūgoca hoti.
analyzed: kim vaṇṇaḥ eso ti tam tam dosam vadantaḥ pariyattim ca kassaci kiñci a dentaḥ dubbaṇṇaḥ ca iva hoti
translated: and he is ugly and dumb.

original: Yāva taṃ nappahīyati, tāva devamanussā averatādīni patthayantāpi verādīni naparimuccantiyeva.
analyzed: yāva tam nappahīyati tāva deva manussāḥ a vera tā ādīni patthayantā api vera ādīni
translated: As long as he does not abandon that view, he is not freed from hell, the animal realm, and the ghost realm, and is not freed from the plane of misery, the bad destinations, the nether world.

original: Atha kho sakko devānamindo bhagavantaṃ uttari pañhaṃ apucchi–
analyzed: atha kho sakkaḥ devānamindaḥ bhagavantam uttari pañham apucchi
translated: Then Sakka, ruler of gods, asked the Blessed One a further question:

original: Issāmacchariyaṃ pana mārisa kiṃ nidānaṃ kiṃ samudayaṃ kiṃ jātikaṃ kiṃ pabhavaṃ, kismiṃ sati issāmacchariyaṃ hoti, kismiṃ asati issāmacchariyaṃ na hotīti.🔽Issāmacchariyaṃ kho devānaminda piyāppiyanidānaṃ piyāppiyasamudayaṃ piyāppiyajātikaṃ
analyzed: issāmacchariyam pana mārisa kim nidānam kim samudayam kim jātikam kim pabhavam kismin sati issāmacchariyam hoti kismin asati issāmacchariyam na hoti iti  issāmacchariyam khalu devānaminda piya appiya nidānam piya appiya samudayam piya appiya jātikam
translated: “But, dear sir, what is the source, what is the origin, what is the birth, what is the arising of envy and avarice? Dependent on what is there envy and avarice? If what is dependent on what is not, is there envy and avarice?”

original: piyāppiyapabhavaṃ, piyāppiye sati issāmacchariyaṃ hoti, piyāppiye asati issāmacchariyaṃ nahotīti.
analyzed: piya appiya pabhavam piya appiye sati issāmacchariyam hoti piya appiye asati issāmacchariyam na hoti iti
translated: “Envy and avarice, ruler of gods, have pleasure and pain as their source, pleasure and pain as their origin, pleasure and pain as their birth, pleasure and pain as their arising. Dependent on pleasure and pain is there envy and avarice. If what is dependent on what is not, is there envy and avarice?”

original: Na sakkā dātuṃ, kilamissati vā ukkaṇṭhissati vātiādīni vatvā macchariyaṃ karoti.
analyzed: na sakkā dātum kilamissati vā ukkaṇṭhissati vā ati ādīni vatvā macchariyam karoti
translated: “I can’t give it,” he says, and he is avaricious, thinking, “It will be used up, it will run out.”

original: Aho vatassa evarūpaṃ na bhaveyyāti issaṃ karoti.
analyzed: aho vata evarūpam na bhaveyya ati issam karoti
translated: He feels envy, thinking, “Oh, that this should not be his!”

original: Mayampetaṃ mamāyantā na paribhuñjāma, na sakkā dātunti macchariya karoti.
analyzed: mayampetam na paribhuñjāma na sakkā dātunti mat śariya karoti
translated: He feels avarice, thinking, “We are the ones who should enjoy this, but we do not own it; we cannot give it.”

original: Ṭhapetvā maṃ ko añño evarūpassa lābhīti issaṃ vā karoti, yācito tāvakālikampi adadamāno macchariyaṃ vā karoti.
analyzed: ṭhapetvā mam kaḥ aññaḥ evarūpassa lābhī iti issam vā karoti yācito tāvakālikam pi a dadamānaḥ macchariyam vā karoti
translated: Or he feels envy, thinking, “Apart from me, who else is there to enjoy this?” Or he feels avarice, thinking, “I have not given it even temporarily to anyone who asks me for it.”

original: Piyāppiyaṃ kho pana mārisa kiṃnidānaṃ kiṃsamudayaṃ kiṃjātikaṃ kiṃpabhavaṃ, kismiṃ sati piyāppiyaṃ hoti, kismiṃ asati piyāppiyaṃ na hotīti.
analyzed: piya appiyam khalu pana mārisa kiṃnidānam kiṃsamudayam kiṃjātikam kiṃpabhavam kismin sati piya appiyam hoti kismin asati piya appiyam na hoti iti
translated: “My good sir, what is the source, what is the origin, what is the birth, what is the arising of what is dear and not dear? When what exists do what is dear and not dear come to be? When what does not exist do what is dear and not dear not come to be?”

original: Piyāppiyaṃ kho devānaminda chandanidānaṃ chandasamudayaṃ chandajātikaṃ chandapabhavaṃ, chande sati piyāppiyaṃ hoti, chande asati piyāppiyaṃ na hotīti.
analyzed: piya appiyam khalu devānaminda chanda nidānam chanda samudayam chanda jātikam chanda pabhavam chande sati piya appiyam hoti chande asati piya appiyam na hoti iti
translated: “What is dear and not dear has desire as its source, desire as its origin, it is born and produced from desire. When there is desire, what is dear and not dear comes to be; when there is no desire, what is dear and not dear does not come to be.”

original: Chandanidānantiettha pariyesanachando, paṭilābhachando, paribhoga chando, sannidhichando, vissajjanachandoti pañcavidho chando.
analyzed: pariyesana chando paṭilābha chando paribhoga chando sannidhi chando vissajjana chandoti pañcavidhaḥ chando
translated: Herein, desire is fivefold: desire to search out , desire to obtain , desire to enjoy , desire to hoard , and desire to give away .

original: Ime maṃ rakkhissanti gopissanti mamāyissanti samparivārayissantīti.
analyzed: ime mama rakkhissanti gopissanti mamāyissanti samparivārayissanti iti
translated: ‘They will protect me, guard me, keep me safe, and defend me.’

original: Chando kho pana mārisa kiṃnidāno kiṃsamudayo kiṃjātiko kiṃpabhavo, kismiṃ sati chando🔽hoti, kismiṃ asati chando nahotīti. Chando kho devānaminda vitakkanidāno vitakkasamudayo
analyzed: chando kho pana mārisa kiṃnidānaḥ kiṃsamudayaḥ kiṃjātikaḥ kiṃpabhavaḥ kismin sati chando  hoti kismin asati chandaḥ nahoti iti chandaḥ khalu devānaminda vitakka nidānaḥ vitakka samudayaḥ
translated: Now, sir, what is the source, what is the origin, what is the birth, what is the arising of desire?🔽When what exists does desire exist? When what does not exist does desire not exist?”

original: vitakkajātiko vitakkapabhavo, vitakke sati chando hoti, vitakke asati chando na hotīti.
analyzed: vitakka jātikaḥ vitakka pabhavaḥ vitakke sati chandaḥ hoti vitakke asati chandaḥ na hoti iti
translated: “Desire, ruler of the gods, has thinking as its source, thinking as its origination, thinking as its birth, thinking as its arising. When there is thinking, desire exists. When there is no thinking, desire does not exist.”

original: Ettakaṃ rūpassa bhavissati, ettakaṃ saddassa, ettakaṃ gandhassa, ettakaṃ rasassa,
analyzed: ettakam rūpassa bhavissati ettakam saddassa ettakam gandhassa ettakam rasassa
translated: “There is this much form, this much sound, this much smell, this much taste,

original: ettakaṃ phoṭṭhabbassa bhavissati, ettakaṃ mayhaṃ bhavissati, ettakaṃ parassa bhavissati,
analyzed: ettakam phoṭṭhabbassa bhavissati ettakam mayham bhavissati ettakam parassa bhavissati
translated: this much touch, this much for me, this much for another,

original: ettakaṃ nidahissāmi, ettakaṃ parassa dassāmīti vavatthānaṃ vitakkavinicchayena hoti.
analyzed: ettakam nidahissāmi ettakam parassa dassāmi iti vavatthānam vitakka vinicchayena hoti
translated: this much I will store up, this much I will give to another.’ Such determination is due to the investigation of thinking.

original: Tenāha chando kho devānaminda vitakkanidānoti.
analyzed: tena āha chandaḥ khalu devānam inda vitakka nidānaḥ ti
translated: That is why it was said: ‘Desire has thinking as its source.’🔽“

original: Kathaṃ paṭipanno pana mārisa bhikkhu papañcasaññāsaṅkhānirodhasāruppagāminiṃ paṭipadaṃ paṭipanno hotīti.🔽Somanassaṃpāhaṃ devānaminda duvidhena vadāmi sevitabbaṃpi asevitabbaṃpi. Domanassaṃpāhaṃ🔽devānaminda duvidhena vadāmi sevitabbaṃpi asevitabbaṃpi. Upekkhaṃpāhaṃ devānaminda
analyzed: katham paṭipannaḥ pana mārisa bhikkhu papañca saññā saṅkhā nirodha sāruppa gāminim paṭipadam paṭipannaḥ hoti iti  somanassaṃpā aham devānaminda duvidhena vadāmi sevitabbam pi a sevitabbam pi domanassaṃpā aham  devānaminda duvidhena vadāmi sevitabbam pi a sevitabbam pi upekkham pa aham devānaminda
translated: “But, Master Gotama, how does a bhikkhu who is practising the way leading to the cessation of perception and feeling enter upon the way leading to the cessation of perception and feeling?”🔽“I say, headman, that joy is of two kinds, I say that grief is of two kinds, I say that equanimity is of two kinds,

original: duvidhena vadāmi sevitabbaṃpi asevitabbaṃpi.🔽Kiṃ pana bhagavatā pucchitaṃ kathitaṃ apucchitaṃ, sānusandhikaṃ ananusandhikanti.
analyzed: duvidhena vadāmi sevitabbam pi a sevitabbam pi  kim pana bhagavatā pucchitam kathitam a pucchitam sa anusandhikam an anusandhikam ti
translated: “But, Master Gotama, what has been asked by me has been answered by you; what has not been asked by me has been answered by you; what has been asked by me has been fully answered by you; what has not been asked by me has been fully answered by you.”

original: Pucchitameva kathitaṃ no apucchitaṃ. Sānusandhikameva no ananusandhikaṃ.
analyzed: pucchitam eva kathitam no a pucchitam sa anusandhikam eva no ananusandhikam
translated: “What has been asked by you has been answered by me, not what has not been asked; what has been asked has been fully answered by me, not what has not been asked.”

original: Ime pañcakkhandhā kiṃ hetukāti upaparikkhandho avijjādihetukāti passati.🔽Ahosukhaṃ ahosukhanti vācaṃ nicchārayamānavasena uppajjati.
analyzed: ime pañca kkhandhā kim hetukā ati upapari khandhaḥ avijjā ādi hetukā ati passati  ahosukham ahosukhanti vācam nicchārayamāna vasena uppajjati
translated: “He considers thus: ‘These five aggregates affected by clinging are rooted in desire.’🔽“It arises in one who utters such words as ‘Ah, happiness! Ah, happiness!’🔽“It arises in one who laments thus: ‘Ah, sorrow! Ah, sorrow!’

original: Ahodukkhaṃ ahodukkhanti vippalāpayamānameva uppajjati.
analyzed: ahodukkham ahodukkham ti vippalāpayamānam eva uppajjati
translated: “It arises in one who is afflicted.

original: “Somanassaṃpāhaṃ devānaminda duvidhena vadāmi sevitabbaṃpi asevitabbaṃpī”ti itikho
analyzed: somanassaṃpā aham devānam inda duvidhena vadāmi sevitabbam pi a sevitabbam pi iti iti kho
translated: “I say that joy is of two kinds, to be pursued and not to be pursued.”

original: panetaṃ vuttaṃ, kiñcetaṃ paṭicca vuttaṃ. Tattha yaṃ jaññā somanassaṃ “imaṃ kho me
analyzed: pana itam vuttam kiñca itam paṭicca vuttam tattha yam jaññā somanassam imam kho me
translated: So it was with reference to this that it was said.

original: somanassaṃ sevato akusalā dhammā abhivaḍḍhanti, kusalā dhammā parihāyantī”ti, evarūpaṃ🔽somanassaṃ na sevitabbaṃ. Tattha yaṃ jaññā somanassaṃ “imaṃ kho me somanassaṃ sevato
analyzed: somanassam sevataḥ akusalāḥ dhammāḥ abhivaḍḍhanti kusalāḥ dhammāḥ parihāyanti iti evarūpam  somanassam na sevitabbam tattha yam jaññā somanassam imam kho me somanassam sevato
translated: Herein, one should not pursue that kind of joy on account of which unwholesome factors increase and wholesome factors decrease.

original: akusalā dhammā parihāyanti, kusalā dhammā abhivaḍḍhantī”ti, evarūpaṃ somanassaṃ sevitabbaṃ.
analyzed: akusalāḥ dhammāḥ parihāyanti kusalāḥ dhammāḥ abhivaḍḍhanti iti evarūpam somanassam sevitabbam
translated: One should pursue that kind of joy on account of which unwholesome factors decrease and wholesome factors increase.

original: Tattha yaṃ ce savitakkaṃ savicāraṃ, yaṃce avitakkaṃ avicāraṃ, ye avitakke avicāre,
analyzed: tattha yam ce sa vitakkam sa vicāram yam ce avitakkam avicāram ye avitakke avicāre
translated: Herein, that which is accompanied by applied and sustained thought is inferior, and that which is free from applied thought but accompanied by sustained thought is superior.

original: te paṇītatare. “Somanassaṃpāhaṃ devānaminda duvidhena vadāmi sevitabbaṃpi asevitabbaṃpī”ti
analyzed: te paṇītatare somanassaṃpā aham devānaminda duvidhena vadāmi sevitabbam pi a sevitabbam pi iti
translated: “I say that joy is of two kinds, to be pursued and not to be pursued.”

original: iti yaṃ taṃ vuttaṃ, idametaṃ paṭicca vuttaṃ.
analyzed: iti yam tam vuttam idam etam paṭicca vuttam
translated: So it was with reference to this that it was said.

original: Na laddhaṃ vata me sabrahmacārīhi saddhiṃ visuddhipavāraṇaṃ pavāretunti āvajjato domanassaṃ uppajjati, assudhārā pavattanti gāmanta pabbhāravāsī mahāsīvattherassa viya.
analyzed: na laddham vata me sabrahmacārīhi saddhim visuddhi pavāraṇam pavāretun ti āvajjataḥ domanassam uppajjati assu dhārā pavattanti gāmanta pabbhāra vāsī mahāsīva therassa viya
translated: “I have not received the Invitation with my companions in the life of purity,” and he becomes disconsolate and the tears flow, as in the case of the Elder Mahā-Siva who lived in the village of Gāmantoka.

original: Amhākaṃ ācariyo aññesaṃ avassayo hoti, attano bhavituṃ na sakkoti, ovādamassa dassāmīti
analyzed: amhākam ācariyo aññesam avassayaḥ hoti attanaḥ bhavitum na sakkoti ovādam assa dassāmi iti
translated: “Our teacher is a support to others but he cannot be a support to himself. I will give him advice.”

original: ākāsena gantvā vihārasamīpe otaritvā divāṭṭhāne nisinnaṃ ācariyaṃ upasaṅkamitvā vattaṃ
analyzed: ākāsena gantvā vihāra samīpe otaritvā divāṭṭhāne nisinnam ācariyam upasaṅkamitvā vattam
translated: He went through the air and alighted near the monastery. He went to the teacher, who was sitting in the day-time quarters,🔽and he did the proper thing

original: dassetvā ekamantaṃ nisīdi.
analyzed: dassetvā ekamantam nisīdi
translated: and sat down.

original: Kiṃ kāraṇā āgatosi piṇḍapātikāti āha.
analyzed: kim kāraṇā āgataḥ asi piṇḍapātikā iti āha
translated: “Why have you come, almsfood eater?”🔽“It is not for your satisfaction that I have come.”

original: Na te tumhākaṃ anumodanāya atthoti ākāse uppatitvā agamāsi.🔽Imassa bhikkhuno pariyattiyā kammaṃ natthi, mayhaṃ pana aṅkusako bhavissāmīti āgatoti
analyzed: na te tumhākam anumodanāya attho ti ākāse uppatitvā agamāsi  imassa bhikkhuno pariyattiyā kammam natthi mayham pana aṅkusakaḥ bhavissāmi iti āgataḥ ti
translated: He rose up into the air and went away.🔽“This bhikkhu has no concern for the scriptures, but I will be his goad.”

original: ñatvā idāni okāso na bhavissati, paccūsakāle gamissāmīti pattacīvaraṃ samīpe katvā
analyzed: ñatvā idāni okāsaḥ na bhavissati paccūsa kāle gamissāmi iti patta cīvaram samīpe katvā
translated: He came to the conclusion, “There will be no opportunity now. I will go at the time of the night-time vigil.” He put his bowl and robe near by,

original: sabbaṃ divasabhāgaṃ paṭhamayāma majjhimayāmañca dhammaṃ vācetvā pacchimayāme ekasmiṃ
analyzed: sabbam divasa bhāgam paṭhama yāma majjhima yāmaṃ ca dhammam vācetvā pacchima yāme ekasmin
translated: and he spent the whole day, the first watch and the middle watch, teaching the Dhamma, and in the last watch he took a senior monk and went out with him after he had recited the recitation.
